chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof, without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.```

Sovle This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
b: lb
a: lb
m: lb
l: lb

Goal:
length l = length m -> l ⪯ m -> a ⪯ b -> l ++ a ⪯ m ++ b

Premises:
length : forall A : Type, list A -> nat
Notation lb := (list bool)
lb_mask_trans : forall l m k : lb, l ⪯ m -> m ⪯ k -> l ⪯ k
lb_mask_equiv = fun l m : lb => l ⪯ m /\ m ⪯ l : lb -> lb -> Prop Arguments lb_mask_equiv (_ _)%list_scope
lb_mask_leb : forall (x y : bool) (l m : lb), x ⪦ y -> l ⪯ m -> x :: l ⪯ y :: m
in_lb_mask_2 : forall (x y : bool) (l m : lb), x ⪦ y -> l ⪯ m -> x :: l ⪯ y :: m
lb_mask_inv_cons : forall (x y : bool) (l m : lb), x :: l ⪯ y :: m -> x ⪦ y /\ l ⪯ m
Inductive lb_mask : lb -> lb -> Prop := in_lb_mask_0 : forall l : lb, nil ⪯ l | in_lb_mask_1 : forall l : lb, l ⪯ nil -> ⟘ :: l ⪯ nil | in_lb_mask_2 : forall (x y : bool) (l m : lb), x ⪦ y -> l ⪯ m -> x :: l ⪯ y :: m Arguments lb_mask (_ _)%list_scope Arguments in_lb_mask_0 _%list_scope Arguments in_lb_mask_1 [l]%list_scope Arguments in_lb_mask_2 (_ _)%bool_scope [l m]%list_scope
lb_mask_inv_cons_cons : forall l m : lb, ⟙ :: l ⪯ ⟘ :: m -> False
lb_mask_sind : forall P : lb -> lb -> SProp, (forall l : lb, P nil l) -> (forall l : lb, l ⪯ nil -> P l nil -> P (⟘ :: l) nil) -> (forall (x y : bool) (l m : lb), x ⪦ y -> l ⪯ m -> P l m -> P (x :: l) (y :: m)) -> forall l l0 : lb, l ⪯ l0 -> P l l0
lb_mask_ind : forall P : lb -> lb -> Prop, (forall l : lb, P nil l) -> (forall l : lb, l ⪯ nil -> P l nil -> P (⟘ :: l) nil) -> (forall (x y : bool) (l m : lb), x ⪦ y -> l ⪯ m -> P l m -> P (x :: l) (y :: m)) -> forall l l0 : lb, l ⪯ l0 -> P l l0
in_or_app : forall (A : Type) (l m : list A) (a : A), In a l \/ In a m -> In a (l ++ m)
in_app_or : forall (A : Type) (l m : list A) (a : A), In a (l ++ m) -> In a l \/ In a m
Relation_Operators.Lt_hd : forall (A : Set) (leA : A -> A -> Prop) (a b : A), leA a b -> forall x y : list A, Relation_Operators.Ltl A leA (a :: x) (b :: y)
lb_mask_inv_nil : forall l : lb, ⟘ :: l ⪯ nil -> l ⪯ nil
in_lb_mask_1 : forall l : lb, l ⪯ nil -> ⟘ :: l ⪯ nil
lb_mask_le_iff : forall x y : lb, x ≂ y -> forall x0 y0 : lb, x0 ≂ y0 -> x ⪯ x0 < -> y ⪯ y0
lb_mask_inv_left : forall (x : bool) (l : lb), x :: l ⪯ nil -> x = ⟘ /\ l ⪯ nil
incl_app : forall (A : Type) (l m n : list A), incl l n -> incl m n -> incl (l ++ m) n
lb_mask_inv_cons_nil : forall l : lb, ⟙ :: l ⪯ nil -> False
lb_mask_equiv_trans : forall l m k : lb, l ≂ m -> m ≂ k -> l ≂ k
incl_tran : forall (A : Type) (l m n : list A), incl l m -> incl m n -> incl l n
lb_mask_equiv_sym : forall l m : lb, l ≂ m -> m ≂ l
Gt.gt_le_S : forall n m : nat, m > n -> S n <= m
Lt.le_lt_n_Sm : forall n m : nat, n <= m -> n < S m
Gt.gt_S_le : forall n m : nat, S m > n -> n <= m
Lt.lt_le_S : forall n m : nat, n < m -> S n <= m
Le.le_S_n : forall n m : nat, S n <= S m -> n <= m
Lt.lt_S_n : forall n m : nat, S n < S m -> n < m
Lt.lt_n_S : forall n m : nat, n < m -> S n < S m
Gt.gt_S_n : forall n m : nat, S m > S n -> m > n
lb_mask_le_iff_Proper = fun (x y : lb) (H : x ≂ y) (x0 y0 : lb) (H0 : x0 ≂ y0) => (fun (x1 y1 : lb) (H1 : x1 ≂ y1) => match H1 with | conj H2 H3 => fun (x2 y2 : lb) (H4 : x2 ≂ y2) => match H4 with | conj H5 H6 => conj (fun H7 : x1 ⪯ x2 => lb_mask_trans H3 (lb_mask_trans H7 H5)) (fun H7 : y1 ⪯ y2 => lb_mask_trans H2 (lb_mask_trans H7 H6)) end end) x y H x0 y0 H0 : Morphisms.Proper (lb_mask_equiv ==> lb_mask_equiv ==> iff) lb_mask Expanded type for implicit arguments lb_mask_le_iff_Proper : forall [x y : lb], x ≂ y -> forall x0 y0 : lb, x0 ≂ y0 -> (x ⪯ x0 -> y ⪯ y0...
Inductive Ltl (A : Set) (leA : A -> A -> Prop) : list A -> list A -> Prop := Lt_nil : forall (a : A) (x : list A), Relation_Operators.Ltl A leA nil (a :: x) | Lt_hd : forall a b : A, leA a b -> forall x y : list A, Relation_Operators.Ltl A leA (a :: x) (b :: y) | Lt_tl : forall (a : A) (x y : list A), Relation_Operators.Ltl A leA x y -> Relation_Operators.Ltl A leA (a :: x) (a :: y) Arguments Relation_Operators.Ltl _%type_scope _%function_scope (_ _)%list_scope Arguments Relation_Operators.Lt_nil _%type_scope _%function_scope _ _%list_scope Arguments Relation_Operators.Lt_hd _%type_scope _%function_scope _ _ _ (_ _)%list_scope Arguments Relation_Operators.Lt_tl _%type_scope _%function_scope _ (_ _)%list_scope
nth_error_split : forall (A : Type) (l : list A) (n : nat) (a : A), nth_error l n = Some a -> exists l1 l2 : list A, l = l1 ++ a :: l2 /\ length l1 = n
Minus.minus_Sn_m : forall n m : nat, m <= n -> S (n - m) = S n - m
incl_appr : forall (A : Type) (l m n : list A), incl l n -> incl l (m ++ n)
incl_appl : forall (A : Type) (l m n : list A), incl l n -> incl l (n ++ m)
NoDup_remove : forall (A : Type) (l l' : list A) (a : A), NoDup (l ++ a :: l') -> NoDup (l ++ l') /\ ~ In a (l ++ l')
lb_mask_equiv_cons_Proper = fun (x y : bool) (H : x = y) => eq_ind_r (fun x0 : bool => Morphisms.respectful lb_mask_equiv lb_mask_equiv (cons x0) (cons y)) (fun (x0 y0 : lb) (H0 : x0 ≂ y0) => (fun y1 : bool => if y1 as b return (forall x1 y2 : lb, x1 ≂ y2 -> b :: x1 ≂ b :: y2) then fun (x1 y2 : lb) (H1 : x1 ≂ y2) => match H1 with | conj H2 H3 => conj (lb_mask_leb ⟙ ⟙ eq_refl H2) (lb_mask_leb ⟙ ⟙ eq_refl H3) end else fun (x1 y2 : lb) (H1 : x1 ≂ y2) => match H1 with | conj H2 H3 => conj (lb_mask_leb ⟘ ⟘ I H2) (lb_mask_leb ⟘ ⟘ I H3) end) y x0 y0 H...
Ascii.N_of_digits = fix N_of_digits (l : lb) : BinNums.N := match l with | nil => BinNums.N0 | b :: l' => BinNat.N.add (if b then BinNums.Npos BinNums.xH else BinNums.N0) (BinNat.N.mul (BinNums.Npos (BinNums.xO BinNums.xH)) (N_of_digits l')) end : lb -> BinNums.N Arguments Ascii.N_of_digits _%list_scope
map_last : forall (A B : Type) (f : A -> B) (l : list A) (a : A), map f (l ++ a :: nil) = map f l ++ f a :: nil
Ring.BoolTheory = {| Ring_theory.Radd_0_l := fun x : bool => if x as b return ((if b then ⟙ else ⟘) = b) then eq_refl else eq_refl; Ring_theory.Radd_comm := fun x : bool => if x as b return (forall y : bool, xorb b y = xorb y b) then fun y : bool => if y as b return (xorb ⟙ b = xorb b ⟙) then eq_refl else eq_refl else fun y : bool => if y as b return (xorb ⟘ b = xorb b ⟘) then eq_refl else eq_refl; Ring_theory.Radd_assoc := fun x : bool => if x as b return (forall y z : bool, xorb b (xorb y z) = xorb (xorb b y) z) then fun y : bool => if y as b return (forall z : bool, xorb ⟙ (xorb b z) = xorb (xorb ⟙ b) z) then fun z : bool => if z as b return (xorb ⟙ (xorb ⟙ b) = x...

``` 
intros.
intros Hlen Hincl Hincl'.
apply lb_mask_sind with (l := l) (l0 := m).
- intros. apply in_or_app. right. assumption.
- intros. apply in_app_or in H.
  destruct H.
  + left. assumption.
  + right. apply Hincl. assumption.
- assumption.
- assumption.
```
